*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. R. Harris to Austin, November 9, 1826. Judicial procedure.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Harrisburg*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="11-09-1826">Nov 9 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir—Permit me to trouble you for the following information, what is the Law or practice in this *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*in regard of a *person_mentioned*Physician */person_mentioned*Proveing his accounts, can he prove it by his own Oath or not. the reason of my making the inquiry is. *person_mentioned*Hunter */person_mentioned*has brought a Suit agt the *person_mentioned*widow McCormick*/person_mentioned* for a Medical Bill and she insists on his proveing his demand but will not consent to his oath, being taken in evidence against her, *person_mentioned*Hunter */person_mentioned*has also brougt suit agt her on a note, given by *person_mentioned*Her Husband*/person_mentioned* to *person_mentioned*Hunter */person_mentioned*for surveying, she object to the payment of the note, in consequence of there being exceptions made to the Survay by you, and she says she never has received her Deed out of the *location_mentioned*office */location_mentioned*in consequence of *person_mentioned*Hunter */person_mentioned*lines being wrong, according to your request I have Taken a bond from *person_mentioned*Hunter*/person_mentioned*, with security for three Hundred Dollars, conditioned to resurvey all the lines that are wrong. I send you a copy of the note*/p*
*p*On or before the first day of *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1825">December next*/date_mentioned* I promise to pay to *person_mentioned*Johnson Hunter*/person_mentioned* or order forty Eight Dollars in Cattle to be rated at current prices for such cattle when paid if the *person_mentioned*parties */person_mentioned*disagree on the price they shall select two *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*to decide for them it being for surveying of my *location_mentioned*Land*/location_mentioned*, and if the survey is not accepted this shall be void otherwise to remain in full force and virtue against me Witness my hand this *date_mentioned n="12-01-1824">first day of December 1824*/date_mentioned**/p*.
*p**person_mentioned*Arthur McCormick*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Attest*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Danil. E. Battless*/person_mentioned**/p* *p* I will thank you for an answer between this and the *date_mentioned n="12-02-1826">first Saturday in December*/date_mentioned*—I send you by *person_mentioned*Mr Moore*/person_mentioned* all the Terpentine that I can procure at this time. If I had of known of it when the weather was warm. I could of procured any quantity of it; after the recpt of *person_mentioned*Mr Williams*/person_mentioned* letter I bored several Trees, but the weather was to could, for the Turpentine to run*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John E. Harris*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Austin's reply—filed with Austin to Saucedo, December 16, 1826:] After an examination of the documents sent up to me by you in the case of *person_mentioned*Hunter */person_mentioned*vs the *person_mentioned*widow McCormick*/person_mentioned* I have deemed it due to justice to order that you should admit the application of said *person_mentioned*widow */person_mentioned*for an appeal taking the security required by the regulations and that a regular transcript of the whole proceedings should be sent up by you to the*person_mentioned* Superior Court*/person_mentioned* of this *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned*—*/p*
*/div1*
